meanings.definition: A small, hard seed or grain
meanings.sent1: The semina of the sunflower fell to the ground.
meanings.sent2: She planted the semina in the fertile soil.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel mistook the semina for a tasty treat.
meanings.sent4: The semina of knowledge planted in young minds will grow into wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The semina sparkled in the sunlight like precious jewels.

meanings.definition: A unit of measurement for weight in ancient Rome
meanings.sent1: The merchant measured the flour in semina.
meanings.sent2: The semina was used to weigh the precious metals.
meanings.sent3: Carrying the semina around all day made his arms sore.
meanings.sent4: The semina of justice balanced the scales of the law.
meanings.sent5: The semina on the scale tipped in favor of the honest trader.

meanings.definition: The male reproductive cells of a plant
meanings.sent1: The bee carried the semina from flower to flower.
meanings.sent2: The semina fertilized the ovules to produce seeds.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel stole the semina for a prank.
meanings.sent4: The semina danced on the wind, seeking a mate.
meanings.sent5: The semina held the promise of new life within its tiny form.
